oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Barber. Geo. F. Barber Co.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Greater Knoxville Illustrated
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Geo. F. Barber Co. from Greater Knoxville Illustrated. Ca. 1910. Published by the American Illustrating Company, Nashville, Tennessee. P. 133 (partial). Pictures Geo. F. Barber, President, and J.H. Ryno, Vice-president and Treasurer.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: architects;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Geo. F. Barber, President, J.H. Ryno, V-Pres. and Treas. Geo. F. Barber Company. GEO. F. BARBER COMPANY. The prosperity of a city is indicated by nothing more than by the imposing and artistic appearance of its buildings, and despite the maxim that commands us to judge not by appearances, it is the external signs by which a city is judged, and in this particular Knoxville must be classed among the leading cities of the South, for a great part of its architecture is not surpassed anywhere. A very large number of the improvements in the city are the products of Geo. F. Barber Company. They have designed many of Knoxville's finest buildings, including the Mc- Kinney Apartments, Park City High School, Knox- ville Motor & Garage on State street and the residences of J. Y. Johnson and Jno. L. Boyd and many other leading residences and business structures. The company was established twenty years ago and has much important work in hand, and is prepared to give satisfaction in design and construction of buildings for any purpose whatsoever, and the record winch they have made deserves special attention. They employ seven expert designers and are well equipped for their work. Mr. Barber is President of the concern, and J. H. Ryno is Vice President and Treasurer.
